content: Bluetooth has always had security issues! Hackers can get into our phones via Bluetooth. Search Google: "Bluetooth Unveils Its Latest Security Issue, With No Security Solution," ... on MSN News/Gizmodo, 9/10/2020. Also, Bluetooth constantly searches, draining batteries. I think it would be safer for the app to keep a record of where we have been for the past couple of weeks, then the VDH could use that to cross-reference to see if any app users were around an app reported Covid-19 victim.
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback. Bluetooth Low Energy is a more private and secure solution that allows individuals’ devices to keep logs and data on its own devices (without uploading any location data for VDH to analyze and create a security target as it contains citizen data). By not creating that database to begin with, we keep users more secure.

content: I appreciate the efforts to curb the spread of Covid. However when I turned off my phone's location, I received a notification from Google's Exposure Notifications framework that I needed to enable location in order for the app to work. What??? Covidwise says that "No personal data or location tracking occurs within this app." I've since learned that while the app itself doesn't ask for location, Google's Exposure Notification framework (used by the app) obtains location data by using Bluetooth. This is very confusing. Please work out the kinks in messaging this. Otherwise it looks like the app is trying to do something sneaky (trying to gather and store my location data without telling me).
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback. The Location Services on Android devices are required to enable the Bluetooth functionality the app requires, even if the app does not use location itself. See Google's blog post entitled “Education and privacy protections” at https://blog.google/inside-google/company-announcements/update-exposure-notifications

Doesn't use location, but requires location services to be on to work. I leave mine off when not in use, because most other apps aren't so privacy-conscious. By requiring GPS, this app creates security concerns that outweigh its benefits. While THIS app isn't directly compromising my privacy, its permissions requirements open a privacy hole for OTHER apps to use. Android *doesn't* require location for Bluetooth or BLE (I use both), but it unfortunately does for this app's BLE tag tracking.
replyContent: On Android devices, location unfortunately does need to be on for Bluetooth to work, even though location is not used by the app, because that location switch is a gate to being able to use Bluetooth. See https://blog.google/inside-google/company-announcements/update-exposure-notifications.

This is a very well made app! I'm a person who values my privacy very much, and this app is made in a way which respects that. It doesn't record location. It give each phone an anonymous ID and uses Bluetooth (which only works ~20-30 feet) to tell which others IDs you were near. If any of those IDs report they have COVID, any othrt ID they were nearby within the past 2 weeks gets an alert. It does not track location or the owner of the phone, only the anonymous IDs

replyContent: Thank you for adding your phone to the COVID fight! COVIDWISE will continue to exchange anonymous keys with other users that have Exposure Notifications enabled wherever you are, even outside of Virginia. However, any user that chooses to submit a positive diagnosis must be verified with the Virginia Department of Health.

content: Kudos to VDH for doing such a good job with this app. The app is lightweight and unobtrusive, and it was designed with privacy in mind. The app is easy to use; you just go through a short setup, and then it runs quietly in the background. Hopefully that's the last you will ever hear of it. If you test positive, you can open up the app and report the test. If another app user that you were exposed to reports a positive test, you will get a notification, and then you know you need to go get tested. That's all there is to it. I see that some reviewers are complaining that it requires GPS, but I'm not sure where they are getting that, since it is patently not true. You can see that much by just checking the app's requested permissions from Android's settings menu. It does, however, require Bluetooth to be turned on, since that's how it detects the presence of other devices. TLDR: this app allows you to keep track of who you were exposed to while going out of its way to make sure that no record of either your movements or theirs is even created, let alone kept. If everyone uses it, then people who are exposed can self-isolate before they have a chance to pass the infection on, and that's a way better way to contain the disease than shutting down civilization. Use it, and you might just save a life, maybe even your own. When was the last time you did that by installing an app?
Does it only work in Virginia?
replyContent: Please check https://9to5mac.com/2020/08/05/covid-19-exposure-notification-api-states/  to see if your state plans to utilize this technology or consult with the public health authority in your state.

content: Want to see
A lot of critical reviews are from people who don't understand the technology behind how ENS works.

The people who give poor reviews don't understand the app or are fear mongering. Just like a mask, this app only works if everyone uses it. How the app works in a nutshell: you know when you scan for nearby Bluetooth devices and you see a bunch of devices? That's what this app does. It scans for nearby Bluetooth, records any devices that are in range & *that have a copy of this app*. The app creates a low energy Bluetooth device broadcast ID that can be read only by other app users.

I would definitely use this, except..... Except it is just for Virginia, and I'm in Illinois. But, I understand that a nation-wide method of linking among state departments of health is in the works. There is a really good article in the Washington Post about this app, and that's where I found out about it.
replyContent: We appreciate your interest in COVIDWISE. The app was built on Apple and Google’s joint initiative called the Exposure Notification System and several other states are building applications as well. Please check https://9to5mac.com/2020/08/05/covid-19-exposure-notification-api-states/ to see if your state plans to utilize this technology.

replyContent: To prevent users from submitting false test results, COVIDWISE requires users to confirm their test results using a verification code provided by Virginia Department of Health. They then provide you with a personal identification number that is not tied to your identity — which you can choose to anonymously enter into COVIDWISE.

content: This app will save lives.

CovidWISE is the official contact tracing app for Virginia created by Apple and Google (collaboration). It is very well made and trustworthy. It does not use GPS and cannot track your location. It uses Bluetooth to simply detect when you've been near someone that also has the app installed (and their Bluetooth enabled at the time). If someone gets tested positive for covid that you've been near within the past 14 days, CovidWISE will alert you. It is all completely anonymous.

A great concept, doesn't use location data rather Bluetooth interactions in order to tell if you were near someone who submitted positive recently. I hope they continue to push for people to download it because otherwise it'll be ineffective with the amount of people with it downloaded currently

Requires that GPS location is always on to get notifications. I thought it just needed Bluetooth. I don't want my location data always getting sent to Google. Also, why does each state have to develop their own app? If I travel, then other people in that other state won't be compatible with this app. Right?
replyContent: On Android devices, location unfortunately does need to be on for Bluetooth to work, even though location is not used by the app, because that location switch is a gate to being able to use Bluetooth. See https://blog.google/inside-google/company-announcements/update-exposure-notifications.

content: This could really help slow the rise of Covid19 cases- it isn't a tracker, just a notification app. All Virginians should use it!

Incredibly useful and their privacy explanation offers an insight into how the app works. I'm glad that I don't have to enable location services at all for this app, and it doesn't seem to store any identifiable information on my device, for those concerned with privacy.

Clever way to do anonymous proximity tracing by using Bluetooth instead of GPS. For those concerned about privacy... check the app permissions... it doesn't require any access to your location or phone storage, etc. For those giving it a one star review and calling it "stupid"... just because you are too lazy to read about how it works doesn't make the solution stupid. It just makes YOU seem stupid.
This is truly the smartest idea that I have seen yet during this pandemic. Anyone in virginia should get the app especially if you did test positive!

Super easy to use. All I need to do is install it and keep Bluetooth running. Having a walk through on how to report would be nice, but there are really only 3 screens, so it's pretty straightforward.
Thank you VDH ❤

Simple and direct. It's your choice to submit the data or to leave on your Bluetooth. It doesn't have any frills, such as other locations where exposure is possible, but for now, it seems like a good step in a healthy direction. Five stars until it turns out otherwise.
Feels good to be doing something to help stop the spread, and I appreciate that the developers are taking my data security and privacy seriously.
Easy to install. Requires no personal information or permissions. Great idea. Proud to support!
Thank goodness for intelligent people jumping on this and getting it out to us.
Hopefully everyone will install this app. I wish it had been developed for deployment across all States rather than State by State which will take FOREVER too implement.
This app requires full network access and grants the ability to view your network connections, neither of which can be disabled.
replyContent: COVIDWISE is 100% voluntary and you can choose to delete the app at any time. No GPS, location information, or personal identifiers will ever be collected or stored. We encourage you to visit covidwise.org to learn more.

content: Maximum Privacy. Please download this app. It will make a difference for you and it will makes a difference for everyone else. This is one easy thing you can do to get us back to a normal life.

Why a countrywide app was not developed and mandated (or at least offered) is beyond comprehension. This technology has proven itself in other countries. Somehow it has been left to individual states to adopt and only a few are agreeing to adopt it. Anyway, although I live in Florida...I installed Virginia's app. At least if some Virginian who reports testing positive with COVID... had vacationed near me in Florida the prior 2 weeks... I will be notified. Here in Florida, we need all the help we can get. Now all I need is 49 more phones for each of all the other states? duh.
replyContent: We will be integrating with the National Key Server so that all states’ apps can communicate with one another. You can view which states will be participating in the National Key Server by visiting https://www.aphl.org/programs/preparedness/Crisis-Management/COVID-19-Response/Pages/exposure-notifications.aspx

content: The app Is well explained about how it works. The key is that it relies on self reporting if you test positive in order to alert others they my need to get tested. So in a sense, it's like wearing a mask to protect others. I feel like reading some of the low reviews, I know who's not wearing masks. I would hope that VDH is actively pushing people who test positive to install the app and report their case to build the database. Load it, use it, tell your friends!

This App is a Virus it hijacks aspects of your phone and sends information without your knowledge or approval... nesides this thing only tells me once it is to late to do anything about it. this is like wearing a condom after sex. so whats the point? other than some company or goverment to collect information about where I go and what I do.
replyContent: COVIDWISE is 100% voluntary and you can choose to delete the app at any time. No GPS, location information, or personal identifiers will ever be collected or stored. We encourage you to visit covidwise.org to learn more.

content: Is this fully functional in other US cities?
replyContent: COVIDWISE will soon be integrating with the National Key Server and be able to communicate with apps in other states. You can see which states are using the National Key Server here: https://www.aphl.org/programs/preparedness/Crisis-Management/COVID-19-Response/Pages/exposure-notifications.aspx

content: Amazed this even exists! Thank you Virginia!

If you don't understand how the app works (spoiler alert: it's not location tracking), it is speaking only to your lack of intelligence. Looks plenty user friendly, streamlined and simple. Mask up, VA! And if you're anti-mask, please refer to the lyrics of Taylor Swifts' 'Betty', at approximately 2:12 🥰😷
Do your part
Protect yourself and those you care about. Use this app Virginians.
I just installed and had no exposures How is this possible if my store that is very near me and that I go in almost daily has had two cases recently?
replyContent: People who have downloaded the app are near each other for a period of time, the phones exchange and save their anonymous keys that estimate exposure using the date, time, and the duration of the contact, as well as the strength of the Bluetooth signal to approximate distance. These individuals must not have installed COVIDWISE to share results.

content: Awesome. Way to go Virginia! First state to roll out contact tracing app developed by Apple and Google.

Amazing that it ONLY uses Bluetooth to identify your proximity to another person with the app. There is No tracking of your location or identify at all! Only downside is Virginia is full of conspiracy theorist who won't download this app bc they think the government actually gives a sheet about what they searched on the internet last night
Good idea to have those apps to help fight the virus
Don't forget to wear your mask, and remember to socially distant yourself! Stay safe!
Great app. Will be successful if folks download it. Just go for it!
It caused my bluetooth to not work and now it won't work again even thought I uninstalled it right away
replyContent: Please contact us at covidwise@vdh.virginia.gov with a full description of the issues you are experiencing. We would love to look into this for you.

content: 5 stars for the concept and clean/simple execution. Will need to update review based on real world use.
Great they're doing this
This app is extremely important for everyone that lives within Virginia. If we want to get back to normal life, this app is the first step!

Really happy to see the VDH releasing this app. It's simple and does the job that needs doing, nothing negative to say about it. While this is coming months late, this app is something that everyone in VA needs to have on their device. Hopefully other states follow suit fast and develop a similar app so data can be shared between people nationwide, since the federal government can't be bothered to help out in a pandemic.
Simple. No identifiers. Choose to report illness (why wouldn't any decent person not). This kind of app has helped other counties fight this much better than we have.
Glad to see that VDH has put out this essential tool.
Just installed it. Brilliant. Proud to be a Virginian today.
We are finally getting an official contract tracing app! Everyone download please
Fast protection
Peace of mind & privacy rolled into one. I highly recommend for all Virginians so that we can control this virus versus it controlling us.
Great job, please offer rapid testing through the app the increase engagement and cross talk between multi state agreement.
Easy and non-intrusive. Do your part and get the app.
No sign up required. No email, no personal info. Just install and click through the prompts and you're all set up to get alerts.
Simple, clean and responsive app.. with complete privacy. And smart idea to use the BLE..
Glad to see our Virginia take a lead on this innovative app! Anything that helps suppress this devastating virus is a blessing.

Guys... It uses Bluetooth LE to communicate with nearby devices, that's why it doesn't need location data. Your phone and another device exchange keys (which are randomized and deleted every 14 days) and if that user tests positive, they say so in the app which then notifies everyone their phone exchanged keys with. Please try to understand the technology here and that they're trying to help instead of being conspiracy theorists thinking everyone is out to steal your data.
This is an awesome idea - so glad Virginia is taking the lead with this app! Just saw a news story on this on my local news. Really glad Virginia took the initiative on this. #VirginiaIsForLovers
App seems well designed and unobtrusive, Thank you VDH
Easy to use. Clear. Simple.
Wear a mask or be casket sharp. Great idea. Be safe.
Looks simple and straightforward. No news is good news . No harm in this and hopefully it will help. We'll see if it helps or not.
Very simple way to help with contact tracing, without sharing you locations or personal information
Simple and easy to install and use. Thumbs up.
Does not ask for any personal information, quick and easy to install
Why didn't I know about this sooner?
Waiting to see if it works. I guess no news is good news.
Doesn't ask for personal data.
DOESN'T use location or steal metadata. Don't need covid to use. Very simple, easy install, one question to answer to make it work. Common sense.
Please install this app and keep us all safe!
Sound concept, excellent implementation. If this is adopted widely, it could save many lives.
Apps like these are a no brainer for stopping and detecting transmission of viruses.
Easy to download. Thank you.

So far so good. Will be nice piece of mind to know that if I happen to be exposed and not aware this may help notify me so we can help stop the spread. I will also be installing this on my kids phones too. Thank you VA!!!
replyContent: Thank you for adding your family’s phones to the COVID fight! For every 2 people who download the app, one future infection is potentially prevented. Make sure you opt-in to receive Exposure Notifications on each device!

content: Easy!
Great Idea, the more people use it, the better it will work.
Everyone should use just out of common courtesy for each other's health and well being. It's voluntary and simple.
Better to ask for givens than permissions.

This app is brilliant. It uses the strength of an adjacent Bluetooth signal from someone having the same app and that self reported they tested positive. I just hope people who test positive decide to turn that key on. Let's help our communities get back on track!
You have to have Covid to enable the app so it's not good if you don't have Covid
replyContent: You do not have to have a COVID-19 diagnosis to use the app. However, if you download the app and opt-in to Exposure Notifications, it can alert you if you have potentially been exposed to COVID-19. If you have any further questions, please visit our FAQ section at covidwise.org or contact us at covidwise@vdh.virginia.gov.

content: Simple and easy to install and use. People giving it 1 star reviews clearly don't understand the technology and just saying "it makes no sense!" Yes it does.
Easy to install and get stsrted. Sounds like it will be good to get alerts and possible contacts.
Everyone needs this in VA
This is a positive step in helping to curb this virus. Set it and forget it is a huge plus.
I just signed up after hearing the governor talk about it. I will stay engaged to see what happens.
What we need to stomp this virus out and get back to normal. Everyone should get it. Again, you will not be tracked and your data will not be saved.
Great
Makes no sense, it wont track your location but it will tell you if you've come in contact with someone. Not buying that explanation!
replyContent: COVIDWISE is designed to protect your privacy and is our top priority. It uses Bluetooth Low Energy technology, which has no functionality to ever collect, use, or store any personal identifiable information or location data. If you have any questions, please visit our FAQ section at covidwise.org or contact us at covidwise@vdh.virginia.gov.

content: This App Takes your Meta Data and assigns it a number then takes your personel data location and history and reports it to the government ..DELETE --
replyContent: COVIDWISE was designed to protect your privacy. That was our top priority. It uses Bluetooth Low Energy technology, which has no functionality to ever collect, use, or store any personal identifiable information or location data. Visit covidwise.org to see a video of how this works or visit our FAQ section. Contact us at covidwise@vdh.virginia.gov.

content: This app change my life. I can't imagine living with out it.
Quick and painless to set up
A very good idea, obviously it's not telling you "Hey you have covid", it's saying "Hey you might've been exposed to it, go get tested." If Northam is pushing it then you know it's good
Good please use this app
Easy and painless
Bluetooth? Makes no sense at all!
replyContent: COVIDWISE uses Bluetooth Low Energy which is designed to be energy efficient to minimize impact on battery use. Some battery use is required to support this app, but you should not see a significant impact to your battery consumption after installing the app.

content: Very simple, private... Do it for your freinds and coworkers
No registration. No name needed. Uses encoded Bluetooth signals. Do your part. Save a life. Save your own life.

The app is simple to use and I like that I can just set it and forget it. The app requires your Bluetooth to be on to work properly. With the extra functionality provided by Google, I'm glad they did not take the route of forcing Bluetooth to be on and instead just providing you a notification. The privacy policy is a breath of fresh air. I was happy to see a COVID tracing app that doesn't take advantage of this unfortunate circumstance to collect and sell user data.
